ConceptDef.label: AvP: Cocoons
ConceptDef.helpText:
Xenomorphs will kidnap downed pawns and bring them back to a safe place and cocoon them.

 The cocoon will keep the pawn alive and healthy until a Facehugger can impregnate the pawn. You can save the pawn by selecting the cocoon and clicking the deconstruct button.

 If no Facehugger can impregnate the pawn, after a while the cocoon will disolve the colonist and transform into an egg.

ConceptDef.label: AvP: Ovomorph (Eggs)
ConceptDef.helpText:
Ovomorphs are the inital stage of a Xenomorphs lifecycle.

They will only hatch if there is an acceptable host nearby.

If no Queens, Royal Facehuggers, Embryos or eggs exsist on the map, it will slowly morph into a royal egg.

Only one Royal should exist on any map at any given time

ConceptDef.label: AvP: Facehuggers
ConceptDef.helpText: Facehuggers will attach themselves to pawns and any animal larger than a labrador in order to reproduce. It is possible to remove a Facehugger through a dangerous surgical procedure, that is highly likely to kill the host.\n\n Do so at your own risk!

ConceptDef.label: AvP: Royal Facehuggers
ConceptDef.helpText: Royal Facehuggers differ from their more common kin in two ways.\n\n They have two embryos, and the first impregnation will Always be a Royal Embryo

ConceptDef.label: AvP: Xenomorph Embryos
ConceptDef.helpText:
Once impregnated, a pawn lives on borrowed time.

 It is possible to remove the Embryo through surgery.

 Do so at your own risk!

ConceptDef.label: AvP: Xenomorph Chestbursters
ConceptDef.helpText: When a Chestburster bursts, it will flee any hostile presences. As soon as it reaches a certain distance, it will disappear in the surrounding, becoming completely invisible unless a hostile pawn goes within 6 squares of the Chestburster.

ConceptDef.label: AvP: Xenomorph Runners
ConceptDef.helpText: Runners are the lowest caste of Xenomorph.\n\nUsually the product of a smaller inhuman host, quadrepedal and less intelligent as a side effect of the combination of Xenomorph and host DNA.

ConceptDef.label: AvP: Xenomorph Drones
ConceptDef.helpText: Drones are the most common caste of Xenomorph and spawned when a facehugger impregnates a humanlike or human sized host.they can spit acid a short distance and are the main workers of a Xenomorph hive

ConceptDef.label: AvP: Xenomorph Warriors
ConceptDef.helpText: Warriors are the second most common caste of Xenomorph spawned from a humanoid host.\n\nFaster, Stronger and harder to kill than drones, warriors are the mainstay of a hive’s forces.

ConceptDef.label: AvP: Xenomorph Predaliens
ConceptDef.helpText: Predaliens only spawn when a facehugger impregnates a yautja, when fully grown they can impregnate female pawns.\n\nAnother side effect of the combination of Xenomorph and Yautja DNA is that the Predalien impregnations mature faster and can yield more than a single Xenomorph, a side effect of this is that it tends to only produce runners or drones.

ConceptDef.label: AvP: Xenomorph Queens
ConceptDef.helpText:
Queens only spawn from a royal facehugger’s first impregnation, which will always spawn a queen regardless of the host.(Unless it’s a yautja, then a predalien is spawned instead).

Queens are tough as nails and pack a hell of a punch, a single queen can take on two thrumbos at once and come out on top.

Queens will lay eggs

ConceptDef.label: AvP: Neomorph
ConceptDef.helpText: Neomorphs are the result of exposure to motes released by a Neomorph Spore Sac.\n\nThey are weaker than adult Xenomorphs, not possesing the spiked tail, but have a shorter gestation time.

ConceptDef.label: AvP: Tunnels
ConceptDef.helpText:
Xenomorph Tunnels are similar to vanilla insect hives.

 Large tunnels serve as a hub, this is where potential hosts will be taken and will produce eggs and small tunnels.

 Small Tunnels are points from which they will attack from.

ConceptDef.label: AvP: Ship Parts
ConceptDef.helpText:
Xenomorph Ship Parts are similar to vanilla Ship Parts.

 However their contents is different.

 They can drop Cryptotubes on destruction.

ConceptDef.label: AvP: Neo Spore Sacs
ConceptDef.helpText:
The first stage of the Neomorph life cycle

When mature, releases tiny “motes” to infect nearby animal life.

An infected creature will gestate a neomorph which will tear itself out of the host after a short time.
